subject: Re: [junit] Essay: The Trouble With JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Look back at my tutorial at diasparsoftware.com. If I rewrote that for JUnit 4, would that help? What content is missing from it? As far as I know, that
messageBody:
Simon Chappell wrote:
>
>
> I'd like some thoughts from the list on a little something that I've
> written. The essay is called "The Trouble With JUnit" and can be found
> at the following URL.
>
> http://simonpeter.org/technology/writings/thetroublewithjunit.html
> <http://simonpeter.org/technology/writings/thetroublewithjunit.html>
>
> My question to the list is: am I over-reacting or is there a need for
> more material for the beginners?

Look back at my tutorial at diasparsoftware.com. If I rewrote that for
JUnit 4, would that help? What content is missing from it? As far as I
know, that tutorial still gets 1000 people reading it per month.

Take care.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
